Sentencas: A nickel-ceria-yttria stabilized zirconia (Ni-CYSZ) cermet material was synthesized and tested as the anode for the direct oxidation of methane in a solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) with YSZ as the electrolyte and strontium-doped lanthanum manganite (LSM) as the cathode.
Titulo: Performance of a Direct Methane Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Using Nickel-Ceria-Yttria Stabilized Zirconia as the Anode

Sentencas: Initially, the electrochemical behavior was investigated under several load demands in wet (3% H2O) CH4 at 850 degrees C during 144 h using I-V curves, impedance spectra, and potentiostatic measurements.
Titulo: Performance of a Direct Methane Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Using Nickel-Ceria-Yttria Stabilized Zirconia as the Anode

Sentencas: Long-term tests were subsequently conducted under 180 mAcm(-2) in wet CH4 for 236 h and dry CH4 for 526 h at 850 degrees C in order to assess the cell stability.
Titulo: Performance of a Direct Methane Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Using Nickel-Ceria-Yttria Stabilized Zirconia as the Anode

Sentencas: Material analysis was carried out by SEM-EDS after operation was complete.
Titulo: Performance of a Direct Methane Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Using Nickel-Ceria-Yttria Stabilized Zirconia as the Anode

Sentencas: Similar cell performance was observed with wet (3% H2O) and dry CH4, and this indicates that the presence of water is not relevant under the applied load demand.
Titulo: Performance of a Direct Methane Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Using Nickel-Ceria-Yttria Stabilized Zirconia as the Anode

Sentencas: Impedance spectra of the cell showed that at least three processes govern the direct electrochemical oxidation of methane on the Ni-CYSZ anode and these are related to charge transfer at high frequency, the adsorption/desorption of charged species at medium frequency and the non-charge transfer processes at low frequency.
Titulo: Performance of a Direct Methane Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Using Nickel-Ceria-Yttria Stabilized Zirconia as the Anode

Sentencas: The cell was operated for more than 900 h in CH4 and 806 h under load demand, with a low degradation rate of similar to 0.2 mVh(-1) observed during this period.
Titulo: Performance of a Direct Methane Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Using Nickel-Ceria-Yttria Stabilized Zirconia as the Anode

Sentencas: The low degradation in performance was mainly caused by the increase in charge transfer resistance, which can be attributed to carbon deposition on the anode causing a reduction in the number of active centers.
Titulo: Performance of a Direct Methane Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Using Nickel-Ceria-Yttria Stabilized Zirconia as the Anode

Sentencas: Carbon deposits were detected mostly on the surface of Ni particles but not near the anode/electrolyte interface or the cerium surface.
Titulo: Performance of a Direct Methane Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Using Nickel-Ceria-Yttria Stabilized Zirconia as the Anode

Sentencas: Therefore, the incorporation of cerium in the anode structure could improve the cell lifetime by reducing carbon formation.
Titulo: Performance of a Direct Methane Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Using Nickel-Ceria-Yttria Stabilized Zirconia as the Anode
